text.0: sing boldly forth Śyāvāśva with the maruts who are loud in song.
text.1: who holy as their wont is joy in glory that is free from guile.
text.2: for in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength.
text.3: they in their course boldspirited guard all men of their own accord.
text.4: like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights.
text.5: and thus the maruts power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate.
text.6: with boldness to your maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice.
text.7: who all through ages of mankind guard mortal man from injury.
text.8: praiseworthy givers of good gifts heroes with full and perfect strength.
text.9: to maruts holy ones of heaven will i extol the sacrifice.
text.10: the lofty heroes cast their spears and weapons bright with gleaming gold.
text.11: after these maruts followed close like laughing lightning from the sky a splendour of its own accord.
text.12: they who waxed mighty of the earth they who are in the wide midair.
text.13: or in the rivers compass or in the abode of ample heaven.
text.14: praise thou the maruts company the valorous and truly strong.
text.15: the heroes hasting by themselves have yoked their deer for victory.
text.16: fairgleaming on paruṣṇī they have clothed themselves in robes of wool.
text.17: and with their chariot tires they cleave the rock asunder in their might.
text.18: whether as wanderers from the way or speeders on or to the path.
text.19: under these names the spreading band tend well the sacrifice for me.
text.20: to this the heroes well attend well do their teams attend to this.
text.21: visible are their varied forms behold they are paravatas.
text.22: hymnsinging seeking water they praising have danced about the spring.
text.23: what are they unto me no thieves but helpers splendid to behold.
text.24: sublime with lightnings for their spears sages and orderers are they.
text.25: Ṛṣi adore that marut host and make them happy with thy song.
text.26: Ṛṣi invite the marut band with offerings as a maid her friend.
text.27: from heaven too bold ones in your might haste hither glorified with songs.
text.28: thinking of these now let him come as with the escort of the gods.
text.29: and with the splendid princes famed for rapid courses to the gifts.
text.30: princes who when i asked their kin named pṛśni as their mothercow.
text.31: and the impetuous rudra they the mighty ones declared their sire.
text.32: the mighty ones the seven times seven have singly given me hundred gifts.
text.33: i have obtained on yamuna famed wealth in kine and wealth in steeds.
